location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 70: Samuel Manesty, Resident at Bussora [Basra], to Edward Galley, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter Samuel Manesty informs Edward Galley that he has sold the whole of the remains of the woollens in the Honourable Company's warehouse. He requests that Galley furnish him with the details of the quantity and quality of the woollens which were consigned to Galley from Bombay. In addition, Manesty reports the return of his express boats, which were taken by the Sheikh of Congoon [KangƒÅn].
